instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Arrived with no liquid damage. Works fine with external. Already tried new screen.

Replaced <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q8400</TRANSISTOR>. Surrounding components are good.

Only 0.45V at <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL>

Where to go from here? No shorts found

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Yes there is internal image on screen just no backlight

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at both pins of <DIODE>D8410</DIODE>; w/ and w/o screen connected.
<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> missing too, no pulse in the first seconds?
Be sure <RESISTOR>R8442</RESISTOR> is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
<DIODE>D8410</DIODE> pin 1 0.792 pin 2 1.105  with screen pin 1 0.792 pin 2 1.098

<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> missing. pulse of 0.80V in the first seconds

<RESISTOR>R8442</RESISTOR> is good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
The new screen is known good working?
<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> comes from PCH.
If you get image, LCD is detected and PCH should enable backlight.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Solved. Bad lcd cable even though it looked good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Do you mean the short cable, between MLB and screen lid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Good to know, never faced with this problem.
Thanks for feedback.
